  1. Loved this razor! --- The shape of the handle makes it easy to get the job done and the lubricated strip eliminates the need for a lot of shaving cream( i didn't use any).....   2. I found the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle razor to be only somewhat effective for me. When it comes to removing hair from the legs, the razor worked very well. I enjoyed the moisturizing strips that made the shave a smooth, quick, and simple process. However, when it came to the bikini area I was unable to successfully use the trimming side of the razor simply because I don't let my hair &#34;down there&#34; get long enough for the trimmer to work effectively. I ended up just using the razor side to clear off the remaining hair and it worked okay, but still left some stubble. I'd say for legs, the razor worked incredibly well. The smoothest shave I have ever had with no knicks or cuts; plus the results lasted a few days longer so instead of shaving everyday I only had to shave every 2-3 days. However, for me when it comes to the bikini area the trimmer just wasn't effective. Thus, I'd likely not spend the money on a razor where I can only benefit from one of its functions.

I wanted to try the trimmer first on my legs to make sure I knew what I was doing. The instructions are awkward because they are printed on the box, so if you rip it open then your instructions will be gone. I didn't know which way to trim or how hard I was supposed to press, nor could I tell how close I was trimming because the adjustable head wasn't labeled. I randomly slide the head down and tried trimming my leg with no success. I slide down the head to the shortest length, and still didn't notice any result on my leg.<br /><br />I moved on to the razor, and I LOVED it. It was a really smooth, close shave, and didn't get any nicks. It was also super moisturizing and my skin was so soft after I shaved. I will say it's a bit bulky and awkward to hold because of the trimmer attachment, but not to the point where it is too difficult.<br /><br />I then tried the trimmer after I got out of the shower, and still didn't have much success with it. I feel like your hair has to be pretty long to get a noticeable difference.<br /><br />Bottom line, I would absolutely purchase the razor portion of this combo again, but the trimmer wasn't for me.

I think it'll be better to use the trimmers on dry hair, wet hair being too pliable and stretchy for trimmers in general.   56. Alright so I got this product yesterday thanks to BzzzzAgent. It was sent as a free product to try out and give my honest opinion.<br /><br />I have only used it once so far but wanted to give my initial thoughts after my first go around. Should I change my mind in subsequent shaves, I'll update accordingly.<br /><br />So off the back I was surprised by the sheer size of this product. Loved the package it came in. Very every catching. With the blues and purples, it definitely appealed to the female crowd quickly. The light blue of the product itself appealed to my four year old son. Upon opening the package I was once again surprised by the hefty weight that it had. It was certainly fancier than any razor I had ever bought. It looked like it meant serious business with both end presenting cutting options. He battery through me and I'll be honest. The first day I got it and opened it all and couldn't figure out what and where that darn battery should go. The second day I was determined. You must twist the middle of the thick center and pull the razor apart in order to add the battery. Once put back together you simple press the fancy blue button closer to the small razor head end. It gives a soft whirling noise and shakes uncontrollably in ones hands. Very entertaining for someone like me.<br /><br />Onto the shaving portion now. As soon as I did the first glide I understood entirely why they called it Hyrdo Silk. It glided on so smoothly and lightly, I had to wonder if it even touched my skin. I know it was on my skin as I felt the cold of the metallic blades but I never once felt the trail to let me know where it started or ended. After three strokes I gave up relying on my sense of feeling and relied on good old eyesight. Was happier than I care to admit as I saw a thick matting of hair on the blades.<br /><br />I did both legs and the whole time I was left to wonder if the blades actually touched my skin. I never felt anything but a cool hand glide lotion on my legs. That is seriously all it felt like. The rubber syrrou ding the blades feel similar to the old Venus razor that provides the built in shaving lotion around the blades. It has a very smoothly, slick texture although upon a deeper press you can easily tell its rubber and not, in fact, lotion.<br /><br />The wide girth and needy weight made it very easy to grip this. Usually I buy the second cheapest razors out there so this was damn near heaven in comparison. Since the handle is a rubber base it makes gripping it all very easy. With my old ones, I would have to tighten my grip if water touched my hand or even worse, soap where to coat the handle. A few times my finger slipped and pressed the bikini trimmer button and I would immediately feel the tremble of the razor. Luckily though my hand was never never it to produce any damage. He bikini trimmer looked too intimidating to test out tonight and plus, I had already run out of hot water so I settles for legs and underarms. Both of which are baby smooth.<br /><br />I enjoyed the razor and only knocked off one star due to not having it long enough to give a full, accurate review.<br /><br />Would I recommend? Oh heack yes! This is a very smooth gliding razor<br /><br />Will it rust? My thoughts exactly as I examined it after the shower. For the most part the handle itself won't but the blades itself most likely will. Anything metal will rust given time, especially when introduced to water frequently enough.<br /><br />Did I enjoy it? It was a fun experiment and I was excited for it when I opened the box!egs. That is seriously all it felt like. The rubber syrrou ding the blades feel similar to the old Venus razor that provides the built in shaving lotion around the blades. It has a very smoothly, slick texture although upon a deeper press you can easily tell its rubber and not, in fact, lotion.<br /><br />The wide girth and needy weight made it very easy to grip this. Usually I buy the second cheapest razors out there so this was damn near heaven in comparison. Since the handle is a rubber base it makes gripping it all very easy. With my old ones, I would have to tighten my grip if water touched my hand or even worse, soap where to coat the handle. A few times my finger slipped and pressed the bikini trimmer button and I would immediately feel the tremble of the razor. Luckily though my hand was never never it to produce any damage. He bikini trimmer looked too intimidating to test out tonight and plus, I had already run out of hot water so I settles for legs and underarms. Both of which are baby smooth.<br /><br />I enjoyed the razor and only knocked off one star due to not having it long enough to give a full, accurate review.<br /><br />Would I recommend? For me, all of the lengths available through the trim cover were too long, so I opted to use it without the cover. I experienced some redness because of this, but it was gone by the time I finished showering, and overall it did a pretty good job.<br /><br /> I then moved on to the actual razor part, which I was excited to try. Both with and without shaving cream, I was able to shave effortlessly and didn't experience any nicks or cuts. Typically I have very dry skin, and even with after using lotion after shaving, within a few hours my skin is dry and itchy, but with this, I applied just a little lotion and didn't have any problems with dry or itchy skin! Even better, to keep my legs smooth, I normally have to shave just about every day. With the Hydro Silk TrimStyle, I'm on day 3 and only just now starting to get a little stubble.

  78. So I'm practical. And a 2-in-1 razor/trimmer sounded practical to me even though I had no idea how to use a trimmer...so I signed up for the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle Razor campaign through BzzAgent. Allow me to fill you in on my first impressions, razor usage and trimmer usage. I am BzzAgent Angneld.<br /><br />First impressions: The packaging was nice and I didn't have to get out a chainsaw to open it. The razor is a bit chunkier than a typical razor, but it has a sturdy manageable feel. It made me happy to see that a battery was included with it to run the trimmer. To get the battery in, I recommend putting the flat part of the battery in first then twisting the razor together. Hidden under the cardboard back insert were helpful pics and instructions on the razor.<br /><br />Razor usage: The razor part shaves nice and close, leaving my legs feel smooth and moisturized. It did miss some random patches of hair even though I went over most areas twice. Also, every time I rinsed the blades out in the water, a large drop of drool would come off of the razor head. It made me wonder how long the moisturizer could last if that much came out so easily. Overall, the razor was good, but the drooling was not super impressive for all the hype on its HydroSilky properties. I attached a picture of what the razor looked like after its first use.<br /><br />Trimmer usage: Ok, I'll confess- I had no idea how to use a trimmer so I YouTubed it. The how to videos were all shown trimming men's beards. From them, I learned how to hold the razor (with the blades parallel to the skin). Also, I learned that shaving up (or against the hair) will remove more hair than shaving down (or with the hair). There is a bit of an art to trimming if you're not going to hack everything off, so take some care. The trimmer has four settings. Three of the settings are found by adjusting the casing while the fourth setting is found by taking the casing off. I would have never dreamed of using a trimmer before but it is just what I needed. Using the guard is nice, because then I didn't have to worry at all about pinching my skin, like scissors would (and did). Taking off the guard is nice for a super close cut that is more gentle on skin than a razor, if you're careful. The one downside to the trimmer is that hair will get stuck inside it and I'm not the best at cleaning it out. I tried rinsing it out (probably a bad idea), then I used a Q-tip. But hairs were still stuck in there as you can see in my pic.<br /><br />Overall, this is a great product because of it enlightening me on the powers of a trimmer. The fact that there's a razor stuck on the other end is just a bonus to me. I will probably never live without a trimmer again...d of using a trimmer before but it is just what I needed. Using the guard is nice, because then I didn't have to worry at all about pinching my skin, like scissors would (and did). Taking off the guard is nice for a super close cut that is more gentle on skin than a razor, if you're careful. The one downside to the trimmer is that hair will get stuck inside it and I'm not the best at cleaning it out. I tried rinsing it out (probably a bad idea), then I used a Q-tip. But hairs were still stuck in there as you can see in my pic.<br /><br />Overall, this is a great product because of it enlightening me on the powers of a trimmer. The fact that there's a razor stuck on the other end is just a bonus to me. I will probably never live without a trimmer again...

  109. My very first experience with shaving as a young girl (I shaved when I was like 10, swim team) was with a schick. 3 blades is what my mother wielded me with to battle my young hairy legs. As I got older and a job I moved to the Venus. It had rounded edges and we loved each other. Schick and I broke up.<br /><br />So when I saw this razor come up to try,(bzz agent, I give my own opinion, received it free.) I was skeptical at first, Venus has been so good to me and gentle, but then I saw it,<br />5 Blades.<br />I decided to give my first love a go again.<br /><br />When my box arrived I was psyched about it and how legit the razor looked. Plus the coupons were greatly received with applause. Now as I opened it up and thought, crud it needs a battery, then wait, low and behold IT COMES WITH ITS BATTERY. And not a junk knock off brand I might add. So as I looked it over I was like ok. We'll give this bad boy a go tonight. Now I have very sensitive legs, like if I don't shave right or with enough oil( coconut oil) I have the WORST bumps and break out in a<br />rash. It's very sexy. I could seduce an alligator.<br /><br />Razor end:<br />As I watered it up, I was impressed but also kind of not excited about how gooey it became. Made me wonder how long this moisturizer was gonna last. If it was just gonna melt off in 2 shaves. (Used all week and still gooey.)<br />Gooey stuff was Moisturizing as I shaved and didn't reek of perfumes that would bother my skin. It was annoying some what though because I had to constantly rinse the razor so it would actually reach my legs to shave. I still have a love hate relationship with the &#34;goo&#34;. Now as those 5 blades moved across my cactus legs, I was like &#34;where have you BEEN ALL MY LIFE.&#34; Great close shave, definitely &#34;silky&#34; smooth. They ain't lying. Now the handle on this bad boy is BIG. I'm not crazy about it. I have small hands for a woman tho so it definitely is going to be preference. Getting into small places to shave while holding onto this large handled razor wasn't easy or my fave. But with as close a shave and as smooth as it was I wasn't backing down from this handle.<br />Trimmer:<br />Ok so. I really don't need a &#34;trimmer&#34;, razor does awesome. Specially this new one.<br />So I can't say what I think of the trimmer on myself. Now my husband has a little hair on the back of his neck/hairline that grows faster then his regular hair so I went ahead and used it on him. Worked great, liked the idea that it was water proof so I could do it for him while he was in the shower.<br /><br />In the end. Schick has mended our broken relationship. Do I need the trimmer and razor. Probably not. Will I buy the razor again? YES. Heck yes.ndled razor wasn't easy or my fave. But with as close a shave and as smooth as it was I wasn't backing down from this handle. Trimmer: Ok so. I really don't need a &#34;trimmer&#34;, razor does awesome. Specially this new one.   112. I was pretty excited to use the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle, especially since it has five razor blades-- a must for some of us who are unfortunately on the hairier side of things. The Schick Hydro Silk disposable razor is my go-to, so I couldn't help but compare them as I used the TrimStyle. The TrimStyle did a great job of giving me a close shave, but the razor felt a bit flimsy. The original Hydro Silk has a blade that contours to the curves of your body as you shave, but that same blade on the TrimStyle felt as though it could come off at any minute. My legs also didn't feel as smooth as I shaved with the TrimStyle. The adjustable trimmer is probably a great addition for those who know how to use it, but as someone who has never used an electric shaver, I was a little lost! Some negatives aside, the TrimStyle is a nice razor for those of us who have a little bit more body hair to get rid of.
  113. Got it free from BZZ agent! I love this razor. It definitely won over my legs. I didn't have any razor burn and the trimmer is an awesome addition. I will defiantly buy this next time!
  114. I received the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle for free from the brand to test out and review and here are my thoughts.<br /><br />The Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle is a 2-in-1 system that has a 5-blade razor on one end and a battery-powered bikini trimmer on the other. Used the razor on my legs and it does indeed give a close shave. Since the razor has a strip of conditioning serum attached, I was able to just wet my legs in the shower and shave with no razor burns afterward. Note that once the razor is wet, the serum does leave a gooey layer on you as you shave over the area, but it's easy to rinse this away in the shower. After getting out of the shower I did not notice my legs being significantly moisturized by the razor's serum, but it didn't dry my legs out either. Also, I did not experience any allergic reactions.<br /><br />On to the bikini trimmer - I was definitely more impressed with this end of the product! The trimmer is turned on by pressing on a button and can be used in the shower or out even though it is AAA-battery powered since it was built to be waterproof. I've used in both inside and out of the shower and while it does work while wet, I prefer to trim outside of the shower as I find it less messy.<br /><br />The trimmer has 4 length settings, which can be easily adjusted by manually pushing the plastic comb in for a shorter trim length or pulling the comb out for a longer trim. I used the 2nd longest trim length and went over my entire bikini area, trimmed in an upward direction, and am very happy with the results as I think the trimmer thins out the hair more evenly without looking choppy like it would if I used a scissor. I do appreciate that the trimmer helps accumulate the hair in its comb, leaving no mess on the floor and allowing you to pick it all up together with a tissue or wash it away. (This might depend on how much hair there is and how long it is, but this was my experience.) The remaining hair was very easy to clean by removing the comb and rinsing the clipper. All-in-all, using the Hydro Silk TrimStyle bikini trimmer yielded a straight-forward, easy, and neat trim for me!<br /><br />The one criticism that stuck out to me is that the razor end does not come with a cover so when using the trimmer I had to be mindful of how I held the product. This is not to say that the razor would easily cut me while I trimmed, but it was just in the back of my mind and a cover may have helped alleviate this concern. Also a cover would be beneficial for storing the razor when I'm not using the product.<br /><br />Still, I'd say that the trimmer makes this product worth it if the product is priced at retail (which I believe is less than $15?)and rinsing the clipper. All-in-all, using the Hydro Silk TrimStyle bikini trimmer yielded a straight-forward, easy, and neat trim for me!<br /><br />The one criticism that stuck out to me is that the razor end does not come with a cover so when using the trimmer I had to be mindful of how I held the product. This is not to say that the razor would easily cut me while I trimmed, but it was just in the back of my mind and a cover may have helped alleviate this concern. Also a cover would be beneficial for storing the razor when I'm not using the product.<br /><br />Still, I'd say that the trimmer makes this product worth it if the product is priced at retail (which I believe is less than $15?)
  115. I have used both the trimmer and razor ends of this handy little tool and overall I really like it. I received this free from BzzAgent but I have used the product on my own and all opinions are mine.<br /><br />Trimmer - this was quick and easy to use and the size of the head is just right. It was difficult to get the trimmer to stay on (they even say in the directions that you do not have to hold it down to shave - meaning you need to press really hard to engage the button) but later on I discovered why (see following part about the razor). My complaints about the trimmer end are that the trimmer does not mark on the body where &#34;1, 2, 3, and 4&#34; are, so it can be difficult to determine what setting you are on, and also that there are no directions or instructions as to how close the various settings are. I chose setting #2 and it was a much closer trim than I prefer. Hopefully this will be fixed in future editions of the product.<br /><br />Razor - a nice razor with a close shave. I did get a nick, but that could be user error as it was only one and I didn't feel it at all. The main problem with the razor is how difficult it is to hold! I kept accidentally pressing the power button for the trimmer - no wonder they make you push so hard to keep it on (see above). I struggled with finding the right way to hold this for comfortable and efficient shaving. The grip is a nice silicone, though, and made it easy to hold on without dropping it, a concern that I had due to its weight.<br /><br />Overall, I think this is a great product. It is so easy to use the two products in one! Makes grooming a lot more convenient. ;)

Also, I turned the razor powe on several times while shaving as the button seems to be right where I hold the razor. The solution was to remove the battery, no big deal. Lastly, although the trimmer with two levels of closeness is ingenious, I have no need for a trimmer as I prefer a close shave. Truly an A+ product! Thank you Schick for getting this right! The main feature that sets this apart from other razors is the built in trimmer with adjustable guide comb. This is perfect for those of us who want a little flair...down there. The trimmer is battery powered and waterproof so you can leave it in the shower. I would suggest though not using the trimmer in the shower with wet hair. I did it to my boyfriend's chest fro and the results were....hilarious. The hair just doesn't lay right when it's wet so the trimmer gouges some spots and skips others. I definitely recommend this razor to not only those with bikini line drama, but for use on the whole body as well. 5 stars. The pluses: 5 blades provide an amazingly close, smooth shave & are infused with a unique hypoallergenic moisture serum which is especially great for those with allergies or sensitivities. The head pivots & swivels easily to hug every curve. It has a trimmer on the one end to handle those delicate bikini areas. One caution (not really minus once you are aware of this): The directions say to use shaving gel. I used shaving cream & perhaps that was a mistake. Some of my hairs were missed because the built-in moisture serum coupled with the cream was too much. I’ll try going just with the serum next time. One minus: When using the trimmer, it would not stay ON unless I kept the button depressed which was very awkward. I experimented a bit & found that if I slid the button forward towards the trimmer head, then it would stay on. But the 2nd use, I could not get it to stay on without keeping it depressed. If my finger went off the button, it stopped. The directions are WRONG on this issue as my razor trimmer won’t stay ON very easily. It was difficult to turn off as well. This issue needs improvement. One huge minus I must mention about this razor is the TV ad I have seen a few times involving bikini clad females & trimming “bushes”. This ad is in very poor taste and will turn off many potential consumers. Advice to SCHICK: Please stop showing this ad and come up with a classy TV campaign truly worthy of great company & a fine razor.
  209. Recieved a free product. Works great, close smooth shave, best razor by far! My favorite.
  210. Alright so I got this product yesterday thanks to BzzzzAgent. It was sent as a free product to try out and give my honest opinion.<br />I have only used it once so far but wanted to give my initial thoughts after my first go around. Should I change my mind in subsequent shaves, I'll update accordingly.<br /> I have very sensitive skin and have always suffered from razor burn and in grown hairs especially in my bikini area.   211. After using disposable razors for my legs and depilatory cream on bikini area for years, I recieved this razor from BzzAgent and was super excited to be able to try it! I used the razor in the shower without shaving cream and the shave was so close and left my legs feeling so soft, that even after two days there isn't any stubble! I was even able to shave my knees and ankles without any problems, something that I have to be very careful with when using other razors. That said, I felt a little bit of a burning sensation immediately after shaving, but I have rather sensitive, dry skin, so that is probably the cause. As for the bikini trimmer, I had a little more difficulty getting it to work. You have to use the trimmer a very specific way for it to trim anything, but once you figure out the direction and pressure that works best, it trims relatively easily. The grip handle of the razor made it very easy to handle in the shower, though I did have some difficulty pressing the button on and off for the trimmer. You also have to be careful with how you hold the razor, because I found that when shaving my legs, I would accidently press the trimmer's on-button which kind of startled me before I figured out what had happened. Overall, this razor left my legs looking and feeling great, and, after figuring it out, the trimmer left my bikini area soft and smooth as well!

The power button took 2 tries to turn it off almost every time I used it but wasn't bothersome enough to deduct stars from its rating. After trimming it was easy to transition to the razor and finish. The razor gave a nice close shave that was very comfortable. Although the handle is larger for this part of the shave, its rubber design makes it easy to hold and not at all awkward. I am used to 3 with my current razor, so I was very excited to see how smooth of a shave I could get with 5. It also has a trimmer on the handle , which is battery powered. To my excitement, the battery was included! No searching around my house to find a rogue remote to pull the battery out of when I need to shave/trim.<br />The box seemed a little big, and upon taking the razor out of the package and installing the battery (which can be done so easily, just a twist of the bottom), it did seem a bit heavy. Upon closer inspection, I noticed that the blades were paired with a moisturizing strip. The box claims the blades are “Curve Sensing,” I’m not sure what that means, but I will say that I did not nick myself once while shaving, even over my knees, my ankles, and the dreaded back of the knee. The trimmer was a breeze, and it cut to the perfect length, not too long, but not to short and itchy either.<br />After getting out of the shower, I moisturized my legs, and got ready for a night out. My legs felt so smooth and silky in my short dress that my husband couldn’t stop touching them all night! I was also pleased to notice that I had no stubble even 3 days later – this really gives a close shave! Since my first time using the Schick Hydro Silk® TrimStyle® razor, I have used the same blade 3 times, and it does not seem to need to be changed yet. I would definitely recommend this product.

  267. I received this razor free from BzzAgent, to review and give my honest opinion on.<br /><br />Let me start by saying, I have used many different razors in my short 11 years of shaving. I usually buy whatever Sam's club has available because it's so much cheaper to pay $16 for an entire years worth of razors than it is to pay $15 for 3 cartridges. However, that mindset is about to change.<br /><br />This is seriously the best razor I have ever used. I have very sensitive skin, so my shaving routine isn't super simple. Normally it goes like this: 1) Use The Body Shop body scrub to remove any dead skin. 2) Apply EOS shave cream for sensitive skin. 3) Shave legs. 4) Apply Soap and Glory body butter. And even sometimes before bed I would have to apply Aveeno for itchiness. Now, I just shave, and that's it.<br /><br />I've used razors with &#34;moisture strips&#34; before, and all they did was get my bathtub all slimy and slippery, or fall apart after 2 uses. With the TrimStyle, I can just shave with no worries. I'm not sure what kind of sorcery went into making the magical stuff that comes out of this razor, but it deserves some type of medal. When I step out of the shower, my legs are smooth and I feel as if I just applied lotion.<br /><br />As for the trimmer, well it's just as great. I usually keep my bikini area pretty hair free but sometimes, it's hard to get into the curves of your bikini area with a razor. With the TrimStyle, I can trim it down as close to my skin as the trimmer will allow (which is pretty darn close) and then the razor takes care of the rest of it.<br /><br />I will be &#34;donating&#34; all of my cartridges and shaving creams to friends and family because I have found the only razor I'll ever need!

But to my surprize the next day there was no rash! This razor left my legs feeling so smooth!   269. First off, I got this for FREE through BzzAgent so I didn't actually spend money on it. Here's my opinion after using it for a month:<br />First time I used it, I missed a lot of hair on my legs, the goo that the moisture strips released were so much that I had stubble and just ended up using an electric shaver after my shower. After a few uses the moisture strip was pretty much like that of a cheap disposable razor and I ended up with razor burn. I hate using shaving cream/gel since I'm allergic to a lot of the chemicals usually found in them and have come to realize that after the moisture strip is done overproducing goo after the first two uses, shave gel/cream is a must. (That's why its not 5 stars)<br /><br />The trimmer is pretty decent. First use, I felt that it was not very good though, I couldn't get an even trim so I ended up with going over it again with my electric shaver's trimmer attachment. The next use was much better and even. I must admit that I rather enjoy using the trimmer due to the size and width. It allows for a more precise trim in specific areas as opposed to my larger/bulky shaver previously mentioned.<br /><br />As for the asthetics and design...I feel there are flaws that shouldn't have been overlooked. For one, while using the trimmer, my fingers slipped slightly and the blades sliced my pinky nail and ring finger finger tip, it was slight but enough to make me wonder why the company didn't provide a cover for the razor. (That's why its not 4 stars. Also, keep in mind my hands were wet and soapy so that may have affected the rubber grip on the handle.) After that, I started removing the razor head when I needed to use the trimmer. Two: while using the razor, I noticed that I would every now and then slightly tap the power button and cause the trimmer to go off, the vibration of it would then cause me to nick my skin which is never fun.<br />However, I did feel that the shape, feel, and weight of the handle was good; not too heavy, not too light, not too thin, and not too thick. Just right for my hands to hold.<br /><br />All in all I give this razor/trimmer combo 3 stars. I liked it enough to keep using it for a month but not enough to say I would totally buy it for $30. Moisture strips don't last and blade replacements at roughly $5 a piece, I'm heading straight back to the Dollar Shave Club blades my husband and I get monthly ;) With that said, I will continue to use the trimmer side. I feel that I get a good trim and its size is quite convenient. I will try to update on the trimmer after the first battery change.heavy, not too light, not too thin, and not too thick. Just right for my hands to hold.<br /><br />All in all I give this razor/trimmer combo 3 stars. I liked it enough to keep using it for a month but not enough to say I would totally buy it for $30. Moisture strips don't last and blade replacements at roughly $5 a piece, I'm heading straight back to the Dollar Shave Club blades my husband and I get monthly ;) With that said, I will continue to use the trimmer side. I feel that I get a good trim and its size is quite convenient. I will try to update on the trimmer after the first battery change.

  311. I consider myself to be a very average female with very basic needs. I’ve never once used a tool as innovative as the Schick Hydro Silk® TrimStyle®, and to be quite honest I’ve never tried a trimmer in my life so I had to read up on them to even know how to use it. I’m glad I did.<br /><br />On one end, you have your Schick Hydro Silk replaceable razor head which is capable of giving a fabulously smooth shave with or without shaving cream. I chose to shave one leg with the cream and one without – both methods proved successful but in the end I preferred the leg I didn’t use shaving cream on! I was able to achieve smooth legs without going over the same areas several times (which I had to on the shave cream leg) and my leg was not left feeling like wet plastic or dried out. Both legs were able to avoid any knicks or cuts.<br /><br />The other end of the Schick Hydro Silk® TrimStyle® is a trimmer intended for your bikini area, which as I mentioned, I had to read up on how to use. I found that I needed to completely remove the white guide because I keep my hair short enough that it wasn’t reaching with the guide on. Once I took it off and found out the proper angle to use the trimmer at, it worked wonderfully. While it doesn’t result in a smooth shave (a given) it does trim short enough for comfort and allows you to skip the itchy stage that follows shaving with a normal razor. I felt no tugging or cutting, and despite my inexperience in trimmers, I’d consider the final result a success!<br /><br />A notable feature this shaver also includes is a nice little stand that keeps your razor head lifted off of any surfaces. I found this pretty convenient as I’m always triple checking how I left my razor sitting on the shelf to avoid having the moisture strips dry to anything.<br /><br />Overall, using this tool was very easy, even as a new learner. Battery insertion was flawless. It does look bulky at first glance because we’re all used to seeing our sleek little razors, but it doesn’t feel overwhelming in your hand while you use it and I didn’t find it awkward at all to use one end knowing the other one was just waving around. I'm very grateful to BzzAgent for allowing me a chance to try this product for free!seeing our sleek little razors, but it doesn’t feel overwhelming in your hand while you use it and I didn’t find it awkward at all to use one end knowing the other one was just waving around. I'm very grateful to BzzAgent for allowing me a chance to try this product for free!

  345. I received this for free as part of a promotion from Schick and BzzAgent. Although the design sounds good in theory, I was not impressed with the TrimStyle. I guess it is more convenient than having an electric trimmer AND a razor, but the design is bulky and makes it difficult to maneuver around curves. It also makes too much going on in one device. You aren't reinventing the wheel, it's just a trim/shave. The razor side is the same as the HydroSilk razors, which have great blade action but have a slimy feel when using it. Legs do feel nice and soft after a shave, once you've rinsed the slime off. I used the trimmer once and will never use it again. The trim length settings were useless, unless your hair is very long and you want it to remain long. I removed the guard (trim length 0) and used it in the shower, and it was painful to use. The metal teeth that guard the blade are sharp and dug into my sensitive skin. It is good that you can click the button down to turn on and it stays on, and click it down again to turn off, but it did not stay on unless you really pushed it down hard. I was halfway through my (frustrating) trim before I realized it would stay on. I gave two stars because the razor side is good, and the rubbery coating on the handle gives a good grip. Overall, this is not worth the money and I would not recommend it to my girlfriends.

  377. I am an easy pleaser when it comes my razors. I can go to the store and pick up some 3 blade disposable razors and be perfectly content with my shave. So when I accepted the campaign on bzzagent to try out this 2 in 1 razor/trimmer, I was very excited. However, I am a logical person, so in my mind I was thinking, &#34;how could this razor/trimmer which is only $15 in stores be any good&#34;? It came with an electric trimmer that has four settings AND a 5 blade razor, at $15! . Allow me to fill you in on my first impressions, and experience with the razor and trimmer. First impressions: The packaging was nice and easy to open. The razor is pretty chunky, but I liked that about it. I liked having a good grip on it. I was ecstatic to see that it came with a battery in the packaging for the trimmer end, so I turned it on and tried it out immediately. The razor was difficult to take apart to get the battery in, but I figured it out pretty quickly. It also came with pictured instructions in the back of the box. Razor usage: The razor was very comfortable to use, and it gave a really close shave leaving my legs really smooth. The moisturizing serum was really nice as well. My legs felt the best they had ever felt after my shave. Normally, I will lotion my legs after shaving, but with this serum I didn't have to. However, while the moisturizing serum is very nice, when I rinsed the razor head under the faucet, you could see the serum washing off of the blade. This makes me wonder how long it will last on the razor. Overall, the razor was good, but I hope that it will continue to be this good after several uses. Trimmer usage: I loved the trimmer on this razor. This is the part that exceeded my expectations. I thought for sure this trimmer would only last for one shave, or have no power behind it, I was VERY skeptical. I have now used this trimer 4 times and it is still going strong! I prefer to use the trimmer without the guard, but I like it to be a close shave. Another plus to this trimmer is that with me enjoying my shaves close, I tend to get red bumps/razor burn frequently when tending to the bikini area. I have not had this issue using the trimmer and that makes me ecstatic! All in all, I have found a new shaving BFF. The razor part is good, but the trimmer is great! Thanks bzzagent for introducing me to my new love!us to this trimmer is that with me enjoying my shaves close, I tend to get red bumps/razor burn frequently when tending to the bikini area. Speaking of which, let’s get the obligatory disclaimer out of the way:<br /><br />I am a BzzAgent, and as such, I’m sometimes asked to try, review, and spread “bzz” about certain products. Said products are sent to me free of charge, but my reviews are always honest and in no way swayed by this fact. What you are about to read is my personal opinion on the Schick Hydro Silk® TrimStyle®.<br /><br />Unboxing:<br /><br />I took out the Hydro Silk® TrimStyle® and turned it over in my hands. Style-wise, it wasn’t bad to look at. It seemed fairly gender neutral, had a little stand built in to help it balance, and—ack! The razor end had no cap/shield on it. Brushing against it shot a chill up my spine, like I’d almost filleted my finger. *shutter* We’ll assume my lack of perception was to blame.<br /><br />Moving on, I discovered that the iinstructions had been printed in the most inconvenient place possible: the inside of the package. Having ripped it trying to get the box open, I found myself ever so slightly dismayed. Then again, would I really need instructions for a razor? Once I read where the battery compartment was, I tossed the box and didn’t give it a second thought.<br /><br />Oh, and speaking of which... THE BATTERY WAS INCLUDED! *content sigh*<br /><br />We can be friends again, Schick. I forgive you for not protecting me against your five Curve Sensing® blades and printing on the inside of the box. In fact, I’m ready to try out your razor!<br /><br />Use:<br /><br />Let me preface this by saying I have ridiculously sensitive legs. Most days, if I’m in any kind of hurry whilst shaving, I bleed everywhere. If my dog jumps on me, I get paw-print bruises. Such is life. That’s why I never expect the type of shave you see on razor commercials—you know, the scenarios where women are lounging poolside, letting hot stranger-dudes caress their thighs...<br /><br />(Ahem.) I may have to adjust those expectations.<br /><br />The Schick Hydro Silk® TrimStyle® gave me the smoothest shave I’ve ever had in my life. I kid you not. It even glided around my knee with ease—my knee! Those Curve Sensing® blades are no joke. I think I love them. &#60;3<br /><br />The trimmer was... all right. I appreciated the narrow head and the fact that it had a little comb on it, but I ended up finishing with the razor end. (I’d already gotten addicted to feeling silky. There was no turning back, for me. LOL)<br /><br />All in all, the Hydro Silk® TrimStyle® is a great dual-purpose razor. I definitely see myself purchasing refill blades in the near future. :)women are lounging poolside, letting hot stranger-dudes caress their thighs...<br /><br />(Ahem.)   417. Thanks to BzzAgent I got to meet my new shower buddy. Schick always delivers great products, and this is definitely one of them. Have not tried it outside of the shower for a quick trim yet, but I'm sure it is just as efficient. Really love this product!
  418. I received this razor courtesy of bzzagent for testing purposes. For the sake of the review, I will be brutally honest. I have not shaved my legs, bikini, or underarms in around a month. I'm going to stick with my mens' razors for now, a much closer shave, for a much cheaper price.

  427. I actually got one of these free to test. I have to say, I was thinking I was going to end up giving it to my sister because I generally hate Schick products and have been a pretty faithful Gillette Venus customer for a few years.<br /><br />Upon receiving this, I kinda said &#34;WOW.&#34; It was heavy and looked to be of better quality than I expected. The trimmer is adjustable and the pastic cover even comes off if you'd like a closer trim. It is battery powered and I worried a little about leaving it in the shower. Looking at the cartridge part, I was disappointed. It looked a lot cheaper than the rest of the razor (including the comfy grip) and appeared to have next to nothing as far as the moisture strip.Then I tried it a few days later. The trimmer held up and worked great in the shower. It cut a little shorter than I expected, next time Ill know better. The cartridge surprised me to no end. I got the smoothest shave I have gotten in a long time and the moisture bar lasted through my entire shave and still has more life to it. To be fair, I hadnt shaved in over a month and my hair was relatively long. This thing friggin kicked butt! Im seriously considering tossing my Gillette out the window!
  428. I was so tired of razor burn and dreaded shaving, but the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle razor has made a huge difference with my shaving routine! I love that the electric trimmer can be used in or out of the shower; I can tell that it's good quality. Both razors gave me a smooth shave for days! This was gentle on sensitive skin and overall well worth the money. I finally have a favorite razor!
  429. I recently received this product for free to try it out and express my thoughts on it. All these thoughts are my own, not influenced by anyone else.<br /><br />I immediately thought, wow what a small, lightweight and cute little razor! I was a bit skeptical, thinking about how much I've let my hair grow during the winter season. Now that summer is upon us, I need to trim up before I hit the pool!<br /><br />First of all, as I said above, it is small and it is super lightweight. It also is a cute light blue color. Perfect to let my husband know that it is MINE and it is OFF limits!<br /><br />I tried this out, first on my legs. I just used the razor portion. It performed well, about as good as a normal razor that you'd expect from Schick. My legs were silky smooth by the time I was done.<br /><br />I then went to trim my bikini area. Maybe it's just me and I've let the mane grow too long. But the trimmer didn't exactly help out. It was kind of hard to use, in fact. I then took the white cap off, that made it a little better. I could tell a small difference, rather than the nothing I experienced with the white head on it.<br /><br />All in all, the razor is excellent. Like it usually is with Schick. But the trimmer wasn't really anything to brag about. The extra head attached was really nothing but a hassle. But it did work well once I took the white part off. I was happy with it. But it could use some adjustments to the trimmer.<br /><br />So I gave it 3 stars because it's a nice razor and the trimmer works OKAY. But if I were to want to buy it, I would need a little more power in the trimmer. (If I could base it on the razor part alone, that would receive a 5/5)

  431. Hey ladies( even men), the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle two in one trimmer and razor to me is a great addition to my grooming routine. The first time I used the razor the serum was very smooth on my legs, now remember the serum is transferring from your razor to your legs so it will not last forever. Fortunately, for me I do not suffer from sensitive skin but this razor left my skin soft and smooth. I think the trimmer works good for the bikini area, great way to keep it short.   433. Got one of these from BzzAgent for review...<br /><br />UPDATED*<br /><br />BLUF: The trimmer is a wonderful product, esp. for the price. However, I dislike the razor so much I had to write a second review (and drop a star).<br /><br />This is my second review of this product (my original is below if you're super curious). I still love love LOVE the trimmer. It rocks, no kidding. This little trimmer can handle a wet mustache no problems! (Not my mustache, by the way. I convinced a friend to let me experiment on his.) The trimmer is the bomb and if you want a waterproof trimmer the Hydro Schick TrimStyle will meet your needs.<br /><br />The razor - I kind of can't say enough about this, and not in a good way. It really stinks. I've gotten better shaves from disposable razors out of motel vending machines. The ONLY good thing about it is the built in lubricant. That rocks. So long as your skin is wet you can shave with just the razor; no soap or cream required. The quality of your shave, however, may leave you wanting, well, less. After my shave my legs were proudly sporting stubble and hairs that were totally passed over. Around and behind the knee are all prickly. The area on the shin where the shin bone and the calf muscle meet is impossible to get with this razor. That tiny dip is enough to keep this razor from meeting the skin; even if you turn the razor sideways and try shaving at an angle.<br /><br />My friend tried to shave his face with it and he experienced the same results. There is lots of stubble under his chin and even on his cheeks! The cheek stubble was really surprising because he has full, smooth cheeks that should have been perfect for a close shave. This razor just doesn't cut it. (joke option!)<br /><br />In short; if you want a trimmer, TrimStyle is for you. It's small, portable, easy to use. If, on the other hand, you are looking for a razor; keep looking.<br /><br />Please see my original review for more detail on the specs and function of the TrimStyle.<br /><br />-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br />Original review:<br />Alright you lovely people, here's the deal: This little trimmer rocks! I'll be honest here, I didn't try it on myself as I have nothing to trim. Instead I went one better and grabbed a friend who sports a mustache-goatee combo. He kindly stood still while I buzzed his face. We were both very impressed by how smoothly everything went. No snagging, pulling, clogging. It was quick and painless! The trimmer is about 1 inch wide; just perfect for delicate work. The adjustable head does allow for a bit of control over hair length but not a lot. The longest length is around .5 inches (perfect for a mustache goatee.) My friend actually dropped by my house yesterday to borrow the trimmer. It's a winner! Now, about the razor. Honestly, I wasn't super impressed. It gives a close, smooth shave. The built-in moisturizer is beyond awesome! If you've ever used fresh aloe (the slimy insides of the actual leaf) then you know what the moisturizer strip feels like. I was actually able to shave using only the lubricant provided by the razor head. It's really nice. The caveat is that you can only use it on your legs (and even then it's hit-or-miss behind the knees). Forget working on your bikini area with that enormous razor head. And don't expect a smooth finish under your arms. The 5 blades are a boon. The plastic monstrosity that encases them is not. The razor head is so large that you simply cannot get into any areas where your skin creases. Now I know this is getting picky, but the packaging on this thing is not very well done. It comes in a standard cardboard box with clear plastic inserts. However, to get the razor out you have to rip the box open. Neither the top nor the bottom opens easily. All of the sides have been glued down. This is not a terrible thing except that the instructions have been printed on theinside of the box and can be (were) easily torn. Please, Schick, add an access point! The other issue that I have is the lack of a cleaning brush. The trimmer head disassembles very nicely and is completely waterproof. Hairs, on the other hand, tend to stick when they get wet meaning that running the trimmer under water does not actually get it clean. I had to use an old tooth brush to remove the excess hair. It's a $15 product (plus or minus) but adding a $.20 brush should be do able. Personally, I'm not keen on needing 2 separate razors to get the job done. I will continue using my current razor which works for legs, bikini, and under arms. The trimmer is excellent and will likely be moving into its new home as a stache-trimmer ;) If you are looking for a good multi-purpose tool the Hydro Silk TrimStyle is close, but not quite there yet.<br />Now, about the razor. Honestly, I wasn't super impressed. It gives a close, smooth shave. The built-in moisturizer is beyond awesome! If you've ever used fresh aloe (the slimy insides of the actual leaf) then you know what the moisturizer strip feels like. I was actually able to shave using only the lubricant provided by the razor head. It's really nice. The caveat is that you can only use it on your legs (and even then it's hit-or-miss behind the knees). Forget working on your bikini area with that enormous razor head. And don't expect a smooth finish under your arms. The 5 blades are a boon. The plastic monstrosity that encases them is not. The razor head is so large that you simply cannot get into any areas where your skin creases.<br /><br />Now I know this is getting picky, but the packaging on this thing is not very well done. All of the sides have been glued down. This is not a terrible thing except that the instructions have been printed on the inside of the box and can be (were) easily torn.   441. I was excited when i received this razor at no cost from Bzzagent.com. I really wanted to love this razor and thought it would be phenomenal since I often travel.<br />Speaking of travel, this razor really is not travel-friendly. It does not come with a guard so you have to put the razor in a bag/container before you pack it in another bag or container. The lack of blade guard is also an issue since that's the end you hold onto when the trimmer is in use. One slip could definitely spell disaster-ouch!<br />I was skeptical of a trimmer powered by a AA battery, although I was impressed it came with a higher quality one. I tried the trimmer several times for good measure and had the same results each time. It pulled hair (and drew blood on one occasion). I also noticed it really didn't seem to trim uniformly with or without the adjustable comb (which I did think was a nice touch).<br />I am completely in love with the little kickstand that the razor has! I wish all razors were equipped with it as it keeps the razor from sitting in a pool of water in the shower.<br />The five blades were a nice touch. Between the moisture serum in the razor and the five blades, it almost seems like you're not shaving at all! I was surprised to get as close of a shave as I did since the blades seem to be set quite far in the actual head of the razor!<br />Overall, I think this product might work for some, but just really didn't for me. I will continue to use the razor and maybe the trimmer only in a pinch, but at the price of between $16-$35 for one replaceable razor head and battery operated trimmer, I think I will stick to the trimmer I already have and maybe explore some of the other Hydrosilk products.

  444. I am 6 months pregnant and, as a result, many of my beauty routines have changed dramatically. Shaving is the routine that was affected the most. It doubles as both a regular razor and an electric bikini trimmer. I now find that I can safely trim my bikini line without worrying about my giant belly getting in the way.   454. I have never used a trimmer before and I got to say, I don't know why I never did.<br /><br />I do want to say that I did receive this through BzzAgent but I would definitely repurchase when the time comes for a replacement head.<br /><br />First off, this razor is big compared to the average razor. I mean, it makes sense since it has to hold a battery for the electric trimmer part. However, this is absolutely not a hindrance when using it because it actually allows for a good grip which I very much prefer over other razor grips.<br /><br />The razor was nice and pleasant -- it got the job done. I honestly didn't really care much for its &#34;Hydrosilky&#34; claims because it was the same as any other premium razors you find in the drugstore. I would definitely continue using this razor over others because it didn't give me that prickly feeling that I often get after I shave my legs.<br /><br />Okay, so the trimmer part is a bit hard to use if you had never used one before. It took quite some time getting used to. Be very careful with this! There are 4 settings depending on your preference for hair length. You adjust to the different settings by lowering the casing or entirely taking it off. I use mine with the casing on as it really helps with not coming in direct contact with skin yet is super effective. Just make sure to continuously clean it out after use as I suspect that a build up can occur.<br /><br />I probably would have bought this product just for the trimmer part but am very happy to have received a bonus razor on the other edge! Very useful and efficient! I definitely recommend this!
  455. This maybe the closest shave I have ever achieved. This device is not only water proof, so you have comfort and privacy to shave, but it is small and light weight for an easier traveling situtation. I have very sensitive skin and the razor does a great job with a smooth moisturizing shave leaving my skin with a glow, its just the best find of the year.

The idea of adding clippers for the bikini area is very new and creative and does indeed do a good job, saves some time, plus it's adjustable! It comes with a single AAA battery so you can use it right away<br /> For those that care about packaging and the environment, there is no wasted paper coming from this, the instructions are printed right on the inside of the box.<br /> All in all, once this one has met the end of its days, I will most likely be buying another due to its comfort and convenience.   462. I tried this product for free, compliments to Schick. I was very impressed overall, I was satisfied with the effectiveness of the razor head and very pleased with the results of the trimmer. When I used the razor in addition to shaving gel, it made my skin very slick and it was somewhat difficult to hold the razor. After washing it off though, my skin felt like silk and I didn't even feel like using lotion.<br /><br />The trimmer was intimidating at first but I decided to test it through trial and error. I did not use the adjustable length because it didn't seem to do very much trimming, but when I removed the adjuster it shaved everything down neatly. I think it trimmed well, leaving about 1/4 to 1/2 inch and I was comfortable with that. For a first timer using a trimmer, I think this is fairly easy to use, but be cautious if you have shaky hands when nervous. Hair builds up fast behind the trimmer head, which is easy to get to with a little pressure around the blade. The power button is convenient for continuous trimming, it does get stuck if you push it hard too many times but I haven't broken it yet. The padding on the handle also makes it easier to hold for a safer, more confident shave wherever it's needed.
  463. I would like to first start out my review noting that I have been using Schick razors for a few years now. Prior to BzzAgent sending me the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle Razor to try for free, I was using a Shick Hydro 5. I have been quite satisfied with my Hydro 5, as it allows for me to achieve a closer shave and the blades do not dull quickly. So, when asked by BzzAgent to test drive the *new* Shick Hydro Silk TrimStyle, I happily obliged. Though given a free sample of the product to test, I am providing my honest-to-goodness opinion of the product below.<br /><br />The first thing I noticed about the razor that it was much bulkier in comparison to my Hydro 5. Initially, this concerned me as I was not sure I'd be able to grip the razor while shaving during my morning/evening shower routines. Upon first go at shaving with the Hydro Silk TrimStyle, this concern diminished, as I found the razor suprisingly easy to grip and maintain consistent, steady control over.<br /><br />The razor boasts &#34;five Curve Sensing® blades to provide incredible closeness while reducing skin irritation,&#34; which I was especially interested in putting to the test because I have extremely sensitive skin. Like my Hydro 5, the five blade system of the Hydro Silk TrimStyle helps me to obtain a close shave. However, because I have extremely sensitive skin, I did obtain a few knicks the first time around. For me, this is normal. The &#34;water-activated hypoallergenic moisturizing serum&#34; on the razor allowed for the head of the razor to glide smoothly on my skin. I am usually concerned about irritation, but did not experience any irritation related to using this razor. The only irritation I experienced, was due to the Skintimate Shaving Cream used when shaving. Shaving creams and gels are hit or miss with me. Sometimes they cause irritation and itching after shaving, and sometimes they do not.<br /><br />The unique feature -- waterproof bikini trimmer -- truly can be used in and out of the shower. It has four adjustable comb settings, which allows for the user to choose desired closeness of trim. To turn on the trimmer, you're supposed to press the button on the razor handle. The button was a bit difficult to turn on/off, but not terribly difficult or inconvenient. I did not experience any irritation or nicks from using the trimmer on the first go around, so I feel comfortable in making the assertion that it does not have a steep learning curve.<br /><br />The only potential issues I found with using the Hydro Silk TrimStyle is that it is battery-operated, which may be difficult for some people to remember to maintain. I am also not certain how long the trimmer would last on such a razor. But, it is important to keep in mind that this is a battery operated, cost-effective razor. For the price, which averages around less than $15 (online), versatility in functions, and quality of shave, you will not likely find a comparable razor.<br /><br />So, while I do not use the Hydro Silk TrimStyle everyday, I do continue to use it weekly, along with my Hydro 5. I love both razors, but the Hydro Silk TrimStyle has the capacity to maintain and manicure those delicate areas of the body more efficiently.Thus, I highly recommend this razor.the shower. It has four adjustable comb settings, which allows for the user to choose desired closeness of trim. To turn on the trimmer, you're supposed to press the button on the razor handle. The button was a bit difficult to turn on/off, but not terribly difficult or inconvenient. I did not experience any irritation or nicks from using the trimmer on the first go around, so I feel comfortable in making the assertion that it does not have a steep learning curve.<br /><br />The only potential issues I found with using the Hydro Silk TrimStyle is that it is battery-operated, which may be difficult for some people to remember to maintain. I am also not certain how long the trimmer would last on such a razor. But, it is important to keep in mind that this is a battery operated, cost-effective razor. For the price, which averages around less than $15 (online), versatility in functions, and quality of shave, you will not likely find a comparable razor.<br /><br />So, while I do not use the Hydro Silk TrimStyle everyday, I do continue to use it weekly, along with my Hydro 5. I love both razors, but the Hydro Silk TrimStyle has the capacity to maintain and manicure those delicate areas of the body more efficiently.Thus, I highly recommend this razor.
  464. I was sent this item by bzzagent.com to use and review and my experience with this razor is as follows:<br /><br />8 times I used this razor, and 5 times I was left with under-arm bumps and a decent shave as the end result. Though on the one hand the bumps cannot be fully blamed on the razor alone, I must say that my Intuition razor (by the same brand) gave me a great, close, comfortable shave and I've almost never suffered the consequences afterward. Then there's also the problem of the cartridges needing to be replaced in a blink, as I only used mine 3 times before the first cartridge needed changing.<br /><br />The bikini trimmer on the other hand, is a different story. Whoever came up with the idea is a genius. Such a simple, yet effective tool that's made it a million times easier on me to hop in the shower and shave down there in record time. It works quite well and whatever your preferred look for your bikini area, the trimmer does it all.<br /><br />Overall, the razor gets a 3/5 from me, because while the bikini area trimmer is amazing and makes it almost fun to shave, the opposite razor edge is just your every-day-quality razor with nothing special that makes it worth buying over the others. The general consensus on this thing is that it's convenient and most everyone is positively in love with the trimmer. So if you're willing to settle for a mediocre razor to get the the REAL prize (i.e. the trimmer), then you're in luck with Schick Hydro's Silk TrimStyle Razor.

The next time I tried using the trimmer, I let the hair by my bikini area grow out a tiny bit more and used the trimmer without the comb and it worked. I'm not sure if mine was a defected one or if it was meant to work this way. I would have to hold the button at the same time I was trying to use it. The button would just stay in on position without being held down and It felt super awkward to hold it while pushing the button. I felt like I was going to end up cutting myself so I just opted not to use it after the first time I tried.<br /><br />Overall I probably would not purchase this razor trimmer after being able to try it free. I would​ get just this type of razor without the trimmer though.
  502. I really like my TrimStyle. The razor is great and the trimmer is very handy. The power button and the size are a little awkward. Sometimes the power button doesn't work and sometimes it does but, it always comes on. I would recommend to others.
  503. I got this product for free through bzzagent to try it out and give my honest opinion. Here it is..... The razor is great. It really is. I don't have to spend a lot of time going over and over the same areas to get it smooth, it gets it the first time. Another great plus is that it doesn't dry out my skin to the point it feels like my skin was ripped apart, my legs stay soft for hours afterwards.   504. I received a Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle razor and bikini trimmer from BzzAgent free of charge as part of a promotion from the brand. After trying out the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle for a few weeks, I have found things I both like and dislike about it. I like that the razor end gives you the close shave you expect from a Schick Hydro Silk razor and the handle is easy and comfortable to hold and maneuver. What I don't like about it is that the thickness of the base of the razor end makes it difficult to rinse off the shaving cream that builds up there. The bikini trimming end was essentially useless to me. I tried using the trimmer both in and out of the shower and I never achieved an even trimming result. Also, the trimmer irritated my skin. I eventually abandoned use of the trimmer side and exclusively use the razor end of the TrimStyle razor. This product may work better for those who like a little more &#34;down there,&#34; but I can just use a regular Schick Hydro Silk razor to achieve the results I desire.

  522. I've had a positive experience with this razor and &#34;built-in&#34; trimmer. Compared to other types of disposable/reusable razors, this is my most favorite. It has a built in serum that's receptive to water, where it helps your skin retain moisture (therefore not being super dry, rather moisturized). The trimmer is easy to use, and is easy to clean (you might need to use a toothpick or a q-tip to clean the trimmer, in addition with little water).<br />The packaging is straightforward - you can open the box, and remove the razor. A minor issue that was that instructions were in the inside of the box (printed in one of the panels) - if you wanted to keep the box for further information, that would mean that you'd have to cut the box. If I hadn't gotten this for free (via BuzzAgent - an awesome organization that allows you to review items), I would have been a little annoyed (especially if I wanted to return it for whatever reason). Also, replacing the razor heads might be difficult (I accidentally dislodged mine, and it took me at least 10 minutes to put it back on... not cool). Finally... the button that you press to have the razor or trimmer vibrate is manual, which means whenever you might want to use that option, you might have to press that for a good amount of time. This definitely lengthened my shower, but it wasn't the end of the world, just a little annoying. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who is trying to remove some additional body hair in a quick way! For me, the positives outweigh the negatives... consider purchasing this product!

  529. I received the [[ASIN:B00SMIIR0W Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle Razor and Bikini Trimmer]] at no cost as part of a BzzAgent campaign. I was excited to try it out- I have coarse dark hair that needs a lot of maintenance and I am always on the lookout for the perfect razor.<br /><br />It was nice to be able to use this razor right out of the box. Just twist the razor apart in the middle, insert the included battery, and off you go! The instructions are printed directly on the box and are easy to follow.<br /><br />Razor: The five blades give an incredibly close shave. It didn't feel like I was actually shaving (for a moment I thought I had missed removing a cover), but lo and behold, hair was coming off of my legs! I wanted to see how long I could go between shaves and it's definitely longer than with other blades that I've tried- 5 days later and my legs are still fairly smooth. Color me impressed! (I will say that my legs didn't necessarily feel any more moisturized than usual- perhaps I didn't use the moisture strip properly- I'll have to focus on that with my next shave.)<br /><br />Trimmer: I have to admit to being a little let down. I have used trimmers before, many years ago, but I never found them particularly effective. I was hoping for an improvement in the technology, but the trimmed area is not terribly smooth and I have red bumps all over. I did like the comb and the different settings, once I got the hang of it, it was simple to use. Taking the comb off and putting it back on is a little clumsy to start, however once you get the hang of it, it's quite easy. I haven't attempted to take the trimmer head out to clean it, but I will do so before I use it again.<br /><br />Overall, I am really happy with several aspects of this razor- especially the shaving blades. I do like having the trimmer option as part of the razor, I just had to manage my expectations in regards to the trimmer. I'm not going to get baby smooth skin on my bikini line, but as a starting point (especially of you haven't maintained that area for some time) it works reasonably well.nt (especially of you haven't maintained that area for some time) it works reasonably well.

  551. I received the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle in the mail from BzzAgent a few weeks ago to try out. This is great for travel so you don't have to carry a razor and trimmer separately. It is bulkier than a regular razor of course, but it's shape makes it easy to pack without taking up a lot of room.   563. First, I am a BzzAgent, and received a free Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle Razor to review.<br /><br />I've always loved the Hydro Silk razors, they work wonders for my legs and underarms, leaving them well moisturized after use, and irritation free; that last one is very important for me, as I have incredibly sensitive and fickle skin. Though the TrimStyle is a most wonderful addition to my favorite razor, I've noticed, the more I use the TrimStyle razor, the more razor burn/bumps I get, and before I am asked; yes I make sure to exfoliate, yes I moisturize (lots), I use a light pressure, and I don't go over an area more than once (unless I absolutely have to, though no more than twice.)<br /><br />There are pros and cons to the Hydro Silk with TrimStyle razor, and I will quickly cover them.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- skin is silky smooth, especially when paired with additional moisturizing<br />- you can get at least 5 uses out of each cartridge<br />- I don't nick behind my knees as often, it only happens once in a great while now.<br />- the TrimStyle is incredibly nice to have attached to other end of a razor<br />- it really is waterproof, I was terrified to use it in the beginning because I was skeptical of its claims<br /><br />Cons:<br />- the handle is chunky due to the TrimStyle being added, I have fibromyalgia, and the handle makes it harder for me to hold, compared to the contoured handle of the Hydro Silk<br />- razor burn in the bikini zone from the TrimStyle, which is an obvious bummer, however, I didn't start getting the razor burn, until I used it a couple of times<br />- because the handle is wider, the razor has lost its contoured shaving and flexible head, I have to be more careful when going around my knees to prevent cuts<br /><br />All in all, I do like the Hydro Silk with TrimStyle, despite it having a few kinks to iron out.<br />I hope this helps!

It even gives a close shave in your armpits and bikini line without shaving cream, and in fact in those areas it gave less bumps and nicks than when I tried it with the shaving cream. I was definitely sold on the razor end of things!<br /><br />I had a little less luck with the trimming end. There are three length options and naively I started with the shortest option. It shaved all the hair almost entirely off, which is not what I wanted. It's great if you're going for that look and you can then use the razor end to clean everything up, but it's not at all what I wanted. I'm probably going to stick with the third length from now on, once the hair grows back long enough for that.<br /><br />Also when I was playing with the trimmer I slipped and sliced my hand pretty deep, so definitely be careful when changing the length options because the blade is very sharp and the plastic cover is hard to get off.

The one on the quattro was amazing but with this one I have to go over and over again in the same spot in different directions to get it smooth. This would be a perfect 5 star review if it wasn't for that.

I used the razor bit for my bikini and got razor burn, which never happens with my regular razors.   705. I recently received a free Schick Hydro Silk® TrimStyle® razor as part of a BzzAgent campaign but this review is based 100% on my own experience. I have to admit I was a bit concerned because I have sensitive skin in some of those &#34;certain&#34; areas & even when using razors labeled as &#34;Sensitive&#34;, I would still wind up breaking out in a rash & developing painful in-grown hairs. I have used other Schick Hydro Silk razors in the past & I have to say this razor lives up to the Schick name. I was pretty impressed with this 2-in-1 razor.<br /><br />Some of the pros on the trimmer - 1.) on one end you have the battery operated trimmer that has an adjustable comb 2.) There are 4 different settings - 3 with the comb on & 1 with the comb off (for the closest trim). I started out with the comb at the longest setting & then eventually removed the comb. 3.) When the blades touched my skin, it still gave me a smooth shave & didn't get my skin caught/pinched in the trimmer. 4.) It's waterproof! Being it runs on battery power, you don't need to worry about getting the razor wet in the shower. 5.) It also has the same rubber grip handle we have all become accustomed to with the Schick Hydro Silk brand razors so there was no problem for me holding on to the razor with wet hands. Some of what I guess you might call cons (which aren't many) - 1.) Not sure what kind of battery life it will have 2.) The trimmer is not replaceable so once the trimmer gets dull, eventually you will have to buy a full replacement.<br /><br />For the actual razor, some pros are - 1.) After you get the hair trimmed, you conveniently turn the razor around & VIOLA!! You have a Schick Hyrdo Silk 5-blade razor on the other end with the moisture strips that you can use to finish up those delicate areas or to shave the usual legs, underarms, etc. 2.) It has a little stand on the handle to it will sit nicely when you set it down on your counter top. 3.) They claim that the blades are &#34;curve-sensing&#34; blades so it can provide you with the closest shave while reducing skin irritation. 4.) So far when using the Hydro Silk razor end, I have not experienced any rashes, in-grown hairs, etc. 5.) When using this portion of the razor I used the Skintimate Shaving gel I purchased using one of the coupons that came with my BzzAgent kit. Being that I was already a familiar user of Skintimate Shaving gel, I already knew that I would have no irritation problems resulting from the gel shaving cream & as I did with the trimmer, the razor also delivered a nice, smooth shave, even in the delicate areas. 6.) The 5-blade razor cartridge can be replaced with any Schick Hydro Silk razor cartridge which means you won't have to buy a replacement as often. 7.) Being a 2-in-1 saves me one less device cluttering up my shower caddy. As far as cons go with the actual razor, I can't really think of any.<br /><br />Overall I was very happy with this product & would recommend trying it. Because I've only had this razor for a short time, I'm not sure yet what type of lasting power the battery will have. As for price, the lowest I've seen them sell for so far is $13.99 which isn't a bad price at all considering the amount of product you get & the fact that one regular razor these days can run you $10+.;curve-sensing&#34; blades so it can provide you with the closest shave while reducing skin irritation. 4.) So far when using the Hydro Silk razor end, I have not experienced any rashes, in-grown hairs, etc. 5.) Being that I was already a familiar user of Skintimate Shaving gel, I already knew that I would have no irritation problems resulting from the gel shaving cream & as I did with the trimmer, the razor also delivered a nice, smooth shave, even in the delicate areas. 6.)   706. The Schick HydroSilk TrimStyle is an excellent bathroom tool. I received the TrimStyle for free as a BzzAgent, and since I already use HydroSilk disposable razors, I had an idea of the performance of the razor. The razor gives a close, smooth shave, even using body wash as a lubricant on my legs (I use shave gel for underarms). The moisturizing strip lasts for about 2 weeks for me. The bottom moisturizing strip got a bit &#34;snotty&#34; after a few uses, possibly from being in the shower without a razor cover. The disposable razor has a cover for the blades; the TrimStyle does not (unless I accidentally threw it out with the packaging). This could be problematic if you have small kids. The TrimStyle does not have a hook to hang it on the wall, which probably would not work since it's a bit heavy, but a built-in nub to sit it horizontally on a shelf so that the razor isn't resting directly against a surface. The trimmer worked great for me - the thin width helped me neatly trim my lady bits, and it was nice to use it & clean off the trimmer right in the shower, due to it being waterproof. I prefer the weight of the HydroSilk disposable for shaving my legs, but love the trimmer.

He thought it was great that it was waterproof, and already attached to a razor. I may need to invest in a second one so I don't need to share :)
  724. I got this as a free item to try from BzzAgent and I was excited to give it a try as I do like the Schick products. I really liked the packaging and I loved the color of the razor. It felt like it had a bit of weight to it when I held it in my hand, but it wasn't too heavy and I really liked how sturdy it felt. I tried the razor first and I was very impressed with how great it worked. It gave a nice, close shave and left my legs feeling silky smooth. I tried the bikini trimmer next. I feel that having a switch or button that would turn it on and turn it off would have worked better. Overall, I like the razor very much, but the bikini trimmer needs work.
