  748. Listed as way too expensive at the moment (come on, $32?), but if the price goes down (say $10-20) it is a good price. Luckily, I received it free as a BzzAgent.<br />The only reason you should buy this overpriced item is the trimmer. A razor is a razor, even though the moisturizing serum is very nice. I would recommend removing the razor head if you use the trimmer in the shower, because otherwise it wastes the moisturizer. It's also really easy to take the head on and off, so even if you are going to shave as well, you should take it off.<br />Since I wear glasses and thus could barely see what was going on in the shower, I much preferred using the trimmer dry. It does have a nice grip so it doesn't seem like it would be easy to drop, even with wet slippery hands. Though bulky, it's pretty nice to hold. IT DOES NOT GET AN EXCEEDINGLY CLOSE SHAVE. I used it without the comb, just to see how close it would go. First, you need to go against the hair and go over the same area at least three times to get all the hair. Second, hair is left, about 1/16 or 1/32 of an inch (I didn't use a ruler). It is very pain free; the only pain from the trimmer was it pulled one hair when I was figuring out what angle to hold it at.Other than that, you can do it without looking and it doesn't (or at least didn't on me) pinch any skin. But if you do it without looking, you can't see which areas you need to go over again.<br />Overall, this is a good product. However, I would not pay full price for it. Only you can decide what a good quality 2 in 1 is worth to you, but I would look askance at paying over $15 for it, especially since razor refills will be expensive.

  796. I received that Schick Hyrdo Silk TrimStyle Razor and Bikini Trimmer as part of a promotion from the brand. Even though shaving is NOT one of my favorite beauty regimens, I was excited to give it a try. In fact, I would consider it to be more of a chore! I do most of my shaving in the shower, and I'm always paranoid that I will clumsily cut myself while trying to get a close shave (it's happened many times before). I mostly blame the narrow, pencil width handles that most commercial razors are designed to have. Unlike the traditional woman's razor, the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle has a thick, substantial handle with a rubber-like grip that is super easy to hold and maneuver, even with wet hands! I didn't know how much I would love this design feature, until I'd successfully and confidently used this razor several times without injury. The smoothness and closeness of the actual shave is also superior to most of the razors I've used in the past. The Hydro Silk TrimStyle has FIVE blades that work seamlessly with the two moisturizer strips (one above the blades and one below). I've found that the five blade styles are most often found on men's razors; which I have used in the past. As I mentioned, shaving isn't my favorite pastime; so I'd prefer to get it over with as soon as possible. In the winter months, I hardly ever shave my legs...what's the point? I was really impressed that, even without shaving cream (just a thin lather of bar soap), the Hydro Silk TrimStyle was able to plow through the results of my wintertime laziness in just one or two strokes. Before using this razor, I would need to go over the same spots about 10-12 times to get a decent enough shave on my legs.<br /><br />I found that the Hydro Silk TrimStyle has the same easy maneuverability when shaving my underarms. However, I'm not sure if the closeness of the shave was the same. I do typically use cream or gel when shaving my underarms, but it is still tricky to keep the skin taut enough to get a close shave. Unlike most razors, the blades did not irritate my skin afterwards. Because the moisturizer strips are at both ends of the blade, you can shave either upwards or downwards and still protect your skin from getting chaffed.<br /><br />I was not previously familiar with using an electric bikini trimmer. The first time I used this part of the razor I removed the trim comb; thinking it was just a cap to cover the blades when you are using the other end. The result was a bit too short (i.e. prickly) for my preference...user error. The trim comb actually has adjustable settings that let you maintain a lengthier trim. Being a novice at bikini area trimming, I did wonder why the blades (on the trimmer side) were so flat. Does this keep them from getting too dull? I noticed that the trimmer blades cannot be replaced without getting another razor. I don't think I will be using this end of the razor very often.<br /><br />Overall, I think the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle is a great tool! However, there are two small qualms that tempted me out of giving it five out of five stars. First, I think the two moisturizer strips are very valuable, but they tend to dissolve rather quickly. Is there any way to make them last longer? My experience was that the first shave (with a new blade) is a lot closer and smoother than those that follow. Lastly, the product I received did not include a holder piece to mount the razor on a wall. I know that Schick makes these, and the Hydro Silk TrimStyle does have a 'clip' on one side that looks like it attaches to a holder. I like to keep all of my shower products and tools organized. The wall mounted shower holder would've been nice to have for easier access.Unlike most razors, the blades did not irritate my skin afterwards. Because the moisturizer strips are at both ends of the blade, you can shave either upwards or downwards and still protect your skin from getting chaffed. I was not previously familiar with using an electric bikini trimmer. The first time I used this part of the razor I removed the trim comb; thinking it was just a cap to cover the blades when you are using the other end. The result was a bit too short (i.e. prickly) for my preference...user error. The trim comb actually has adjustable settings that let you maintain a lengthier trim. Being a novice at bikini area trimming, I did wonder why the blades (on the trimmer side) were so flat. Does this keep them from getting too dull? I noticed that the trimmer blades cannot be replaced without getting another razor. I don't think I will be using this end of the razor very often. Overall, I think the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle is a great tool! However, there are two small qualms that tempted me out of giving it five out of five stars. First, I think the two moisturizer strips are very valuable, but they tend to dissolve rather quickly. Is there any way to make them last longer? My experience was that the first shave (with a new blade) is a lot closer and smoother than those that follow. Lastly, the product I received did not include a holder piece to mount the razor on a wall. I know that Schick makes these, and the Hydro Silk TrimStyle does have a 'clip' on one side that looks like it attaches to a holder. I like to keep all of my shower products and tools organized. The wall mounted shower holder would've been nice to have for easier access.
  797. So, I always bought those packs of disposable razors, maybe they'd have twin blades or something, thinking those were fine. Good enough. I was... wrong! Shaving with the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle razor was such a huge difference, like night and day. This razor has five blades, and glides so much better on the skin. It caused so much less irritation, which I had accepted as a regular part of shaving my sensitive skin. Even with using a good shaving cream, those disposable twin blade razors still don't hold a candle, and the TrimStyle is made even better. And that's only half of it...<br /><br />The trimmer! I never used a trimmer before, and now I'm never looking back. The trimmer on the other end of this razor has an adjustable comb attachment. This is cool, because you can adjust it to your personal preference. Being waterproof, you can use this in the shower right after shaving legs, and that's super convenient. The batter being included is a bonus as well; you're ready to go as soon as you open this bad boy up. Indeed, instructions are included as well.<br /><br />Overall, this is the best razor I've ever used. I'm never going back to disposable twin blades. I plan on keeping the handle with trimmer end for as long as it lasts, and simply replacing spent razor heads as needed. My skin has never felt better after shaving, I know it's the 5 bladed Hydro Silk razor to thank!<br /><br />[I received this free for review from BzzAgent. All opinions expressed are my own.]

Tada! Bikini ready!<br /><br />Prior to Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle I had to pull out a on-waterproof razor, pull it in and trim the long hairs. During this process hairs often caught in the razor and left a severe amount of pain or I'd nick myself while trying to trim around the curves of the bikini zone. This was all the beginning, trimming alone always was a chore I saved for special occasions. After trimming, I used to swap out two razors while in the shower, depending on if my legs needed further moisturizing. I had one to finish off the bikini zone (to remove the remaining hair so I wouldn't have to trim again so soon) and the second razor used for legs and armpits, which are typically maintained more frequently. This process took much longer, and got far too expensive.<br /><br />The Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle razor hasn't caused any pain or nicks since I switched. My legs are silky smooth for days. My bikini zone is ready for summer. And I don't have to save Shave-Day for a late night nor schedule it on the calender to make sure I have a babysitter. Just kidding about that last part. I've saved time, energy, and money by switching and I'm loving the results. I hope you found this enlightening.

  826. I received the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle about a week ago from BzzAgent and I must say... it is probably one of the best razors I have ever used.<br /><br />When I relieved the package, it was not only appealing to the eye but also did not require a chainsaw to open. This was a nice change from most other razor packages I have dealt with. The handle was a nice blue color and, since the battery is stored there (just twist the handle in half to open), was bulkier than most I have used. I know some people didn't like the bulkiness but personally, I thought the bigger handle made it easier to control while shaving.<br /><br />Speaking of shaving... the razor was amazing! I could barely tell it was touching my skin as it effortlessly glided over my legs. It left them silky smooth to the touch and nicely moisturized. I didn't even really need to use shaving cream, like I normally do. I've only used the trimmer twice, once in the shower and once out, and I am not sure I have gotten the hang of it. I set it on the closest setting and it either cut the hair super short or didn't seem to cut it at all. I think I have just not figured out how to use it. I still think it works pretty well... and it would be easy to use if you just needed a quick touch-up. The trimmer is also quite easy to clean... just take off the guard and run some water of the blades.<br /><br />When you turn on the trimmer, it is a bit loud... but anything that buzzes is going to make quite a bit of noise. If you live in a college dorm... expect someone to possibly ask you what you are doing in there.<br /><br />Over all, I would highly recommend at least giving this razor a chance. The trimmer might take some use getting use to, if you have never used something like that but I think it has a lot of potential. It only takes one AAA battery, which was a plus since I am a college student that doesn't have a lot of money to buy tons of batteries. The razor leaves your legs super smooth and free of razor burn (I consider my skin pretty sensitive... most razors leave me with a little razor burn).<br /><br />Glad I got the chance to try this razor.. most razors leave me with a little razor burn). Glad I got the chance to try this razor.

  848. Don't let Schick fool you, this isn't a new concept at all. The sensitive blade including with this trimmer has a moisturizing strip and is rounded and larger than the Quattro blade. I like it for shaving.<br /><br />Because of the trimmer and the AAA battery, the general handle is thicker. This means the Hydro Silk travel &#34;cover&#34; doesn't fit, and it doesn't fit on hooks in caddies. There are little &#34;feet&#34; on the bottom of the razor to set it on a flat surface, which my shower stall doesn't have. The suction cup might have been a nice inclusion with this.<br /><br />A single button turns on the trimmer, which you can use by itself or with the guide. You're not going to get a trim as close as the razor with just the metal trimmer, but the trimmer is easy on your skin. The plastic guide protects your hand from scraping on it if you're just using the razor, and you can adjust it to three different lengths, but I don't find it to be so precise so I don't typically use it.<br /><br />If you want to add a design to your pubic hair, you'll definitely need to trim to remove length from hair you're keeping and then use the razor to do the outlines. Because you still need both, it might not be as convenient as you think, and this is one reason why I just don't love the new Trimstyle.<br /><br />I'll still use it as long as it works, but my original randomly stopped working within a few months, so i don't have high hopes.<br /><br />I received this program for free as part of a review promotion from BzzAgent and Schick.

I have used it on my arm pits every other day especially since I like going to the gym and no one wants to lift their arms at the gym and show hairy armpits well I know I dont! My Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle razor is conveniently perched on my window sill in my shower and I dont have to worry about it touching the shower tiles or the blades soaking in water/moisture and breeding bacteria.The trimmer is great for the bikini area if you want to get a quick trim, mind you I said quick trim so it's not really meant to leave you completely hairless. I have always hated shaving because the razors I use, give me razor burn, or I miss hair, and have to spend 15 minutes going over and over my legs and don't even get me started on how long it takes to get every nook and cranny of my bikini area to be hair free. It's like a LABYRINTH down there! I got my new free Schick Hydro Silk Trimstyle razor in the mail about a week ago, and I did an experiment. I shaved my right leg with my normal disposable razor (a new one) and Silk shaving cream. Then, I shaved my left leg with the new Hydro Silk, no shaving cream.<br /><br />The right leg was the same as always: a bit painful, got some razor burn, missed some hair, and spent about 5-8 minutes trying to get everything smooth. I shaved my left leg with my new Hydro Silk, and OMG so much better!! I didn't regret not using shaving cream, and my leg was SOOOOO much smoother feeling with whatever awesome lotion they have in the razor head. I have sensitive skin, so shaving usually means soreness, redness, and stinging. So, as far as the razor goes, this new product gets 5 stars from me! However, overall, I have to give 4 stars. Here is why:<br /><br />I was excited to try out the new battery operated bikini end of the Schick Hydro Silk. I'd never used an electronic bikini shaver before. There are three lengths you can set the white plastic razor guard to so you can pick your hair length. I tried all three settings, and I even took off the guard and tried using the razor that way, but for the life of me I couldn't get it to work in my bikini hair area. It could have been that my hair was already too short, but I was a little disappointed that I couldn't get it to shave like I wanted. HOWEVER, even though I couldn't get it to work for it's intended purpose, I again decided to experiment. Some of you may think I'm crazy but oh my goodness, the electronic &#34;bikini&#34; shaver works AMAZINGLY well for trimming/removing:<br /><br />1. Arm hair<br />2. EYEBROW (yes Eyebrow) hair (not recommended if you don't have steady hands)<br />3. Trimming up any unwanted facial hair (female sideburn hair for example)<br />4. Boyfriend/Fiance/Husband beard trimmer<br /><br />So, I will be using my new Schick Hydro Silk Trimstyle razor for everything now, and I DO highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a convenient all in one razor for just about any hair on their body. I will be using the manual razor end for my bikini area, legs, and underarms, but the electric end will be my go to for everything else. :) Thanks for the great product! I love being a BzzAgent, and I loved receiving this free new product to try from Schick. :)<br /><br />P.S. - I realize that this review makes it sound like I am a hairy gorilla, but I am not. Lolrks AMAZINGLY well for trimming/removing:<br /><br />1. Arm hair<br />2. EYEBROW (yes Eyebrow) hair (not recommended if you don't have steady hands)<br />3. Trimming up any unwanted facial hair (female sideburn hair for example)<br />4. Boyfriend/Fiance/Husband beard trimmer<br /><br />So, I will be using my new Schick Hydro Silk Trimstyle razor for everything now, and I DO highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a convenient all in one razor for just about any hair on their body. I will be using the manual razor end for my bikini area, legs, and underarms, but the electric end will be my go to for everything else. :) Thanks for the great product! I love being a BzzAgent, and I loved receiving this free new product to try from Schick. :)<br /><br />P.S. - I realize that this review makes it sound like I am a hairy gorilla, but I am not. Lol
  886. Recently received this razor as a trial through bzz agent, so I did not purchase. I typically use the venus razor. I wasn't a huge fan of the trimmer for the bikini area because it didn't really get the closeness that I wanted and I wouldn't have felt comfortable in a bathing suit. I used the closest setting and I felt that it didn't get anywhere near close enough. Another negative for me was the shape/design of the razors handle. The handle is very bulky and its hard to compare it to something but the closest comparison that I can make is to a very thick pencil. With the battery it is pretty heavy also. There is no shape to the design. Another issue I had was that (prior to reading the instructions) the button to turn the trimmer on was not staying on so I thought that you would have to hold the button down while shaving which would just add to the awkwardness of the razor. You don't have to hold the button but you do have to push the button harder then would be expected. razor on the other hand was wonderful!! It has a moisturizing strip that left my legs feeling AMAZING!!! I shaved as I normally do, every other day with shaving cream and with the moisturizer my legs never felt smoother! The razor gave me such a close shave that I had very minimal stubble before my next shave! In short I loved the razor but would not recommend the trimmer.

  918. I generally like to keep a clean shave, so I wouldn't normally buy this product for myself as I feel the main reason someone may buy this over another razor is for the trimmer. However, I was very excited when I got the bzzkit offer for this razor, and I wanted to give the best review possible so I didn't shave for about 2 weeks-legs, underarms, or bikini area. Now before this began I was already using the Shick Hydro disposable razors, and was very satisfied, I like razors with 4+ blades and a moisture strip, for a close shave without razor burn. So this morning I tried out my free razor and trimmer. I first tried the trimmer outside of the shower, it was a little awkward to use but I account that to being in my 9th month of pregnancy and everything being awkward, it did what it was supposed to do. I think if the user were not in the third trimester and did not keep a clean shave, this is an amazing option and does what its supposed to do, with no irritation. The blade itself is small enough to be able to control it easily and I feel that if you wanted to you could do some intricate bikini area art with it. It's just not my thing, so I moved on to the shower. It shaved my underarms exactly the way I expected and worked just as well as the disposable Shick Hydro. Continuing on, I tried to shave my bikini area, again this was awkward, but more so than when using the disposable, the handle was unusually thick and strange to hold, halfway through I switched back to the disposable to finish the job. Moving on to my legs, I expected this to shave exactly like the disposable with a different handle, when using on my legs the handle was not awkward at all, I liked the extra weight, however, the shave did not feel the same as the disposable, it felt a little rough and dragged along my leg, which is not the case for the disposable version which glides along and feels very hydrating. I feel like if I were to continue to use this product to shave my legs I would HAVE to use shaving cream, which I don't usually do. After the fact though I do not have any razor burn, so I'm not sure what the drag was that I was feeling, and I do have a smooth close shave. Overall I think the product works well, and does exactly what it is meant to do. As far as the design goes, I really like the color and size of the razor, while it was a bit awkward on my labybits, I account that to the pregnancy, as I enjoyed the weight while shaving my legs. I also like the little kick stand to keep the razor off the surface it's been placed on, and I will point out the disposables has this as well. I'm not sure why the disposable razor of the same brand felt more hydrating to me, but if I were into a different shave the trimmer is an excellent thing, and using shaving cream a small sacrifice. It just isn't for me though and I will continue to buy and use the disposable Shick Hydro razors. I would recommend this to any lady friends who could use the trimmer option though as I still feel that is the number one feature for this product.aving cream, which I don't usually do. After the fact though I do not have any razor burn, so I'm not sure what the drag was that I was feeling, and I do have a smooth close shave. Overall I think the product works well, and does exactly what it is meant to do. As far as the design goes, I really like the color and size of the razor, while it was a bit awkward on my labybits, I account that to the pregnancy, as I enjoyed the weight while shaving my legs. I also like the little kick stand to keep the razor off the surface it's been placed on, and I will point out the disposables has this as well. I'm not sure why the disposable razor of the same brand felt more hydrating to me, but if I were into a different shave the trimmer is an excellent thing, and using shaving cream a small sacrifice. It just isn't for me though and I will continue to buy and use the disposable Shick Hydro razors. I would recommend this to any lady friends who could use the trimmer option though as I still feel that is the number one feature for this product.

  921. I started out my adventure with the Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle with high hopes. The trimmer/razor combination is shower friendly, the brand is well known, and the overall design feels nice in your hand. I was especially impressed with the simplest feature - there is a little plastic triangle shape on the handle, it has one job, to keep your razor blade from sitting on the counter/in water. It's so perfect, I can't believe it's not standard practice to have that feature!<br /><br />As to the usability? Iffy at best on the trimmer. If your hair is a little less densely populated in the area you're shaving, it's pretty useless. I guess if you're starting from a long growth time, it would save your razor blade some hard work, but for general upkeep, it's not all that helpful. It is good at trimming densely populated hair with a better degree of finesse than regular clippers, though.<br /><br />The razor part of this duo is much more universally usable. It's a pretty standard multiblade razor with moisture strip. The moisture strip is large enough to make maneuvering in sensitive areas challenging. Which is beyond frustrating in a razor designed to help you groom those areas. It gives a close shave... and then some. Some razors are just more nick prone than others and, unfortunately, this is one of those. Something about the way the blades sit just make me more likely to get cut. This time It was where my shin and foot meet.<br /><br />Overall - I got a good shave from the razor. The trimmer isn't something that'll work for me. I like the idea, love the overall design, but would like to see it trimmed down a bit for better use.<br /><br />I got to try this product for free, courtesy of Schick, as part of a #BzzAgent Bzz Campaign. #GotItFree

I pressed the button more firmly and held for a second longer and the trimmer remained operational without constantly holding down the button. Other than this happening a few times, it has been great the rest of the time, and even though it now seems like most of the strip is gone (time to change the blade, lol), I'm still getting a good smooth shave.   1009. So excited to receive this free from BzzAgent. Overall, I really liked the razor. The 5 blades gave me an amazingly close shave with no cuts! I was really happy that this razor contained hypoallergenic moisture serum because I have some allergies and sensitivities to certain cosmetics and beauty products. While the serum did not irritate my skin, I noticed that while shaving, the serum started accumulating and became a glob that stuck to the blades. I had to keep rinsing the blades off in order to keep a close shave but otherwise it worked just fine. As I continued to use the razor, this problem began to subside.<br /><br />As far as the trimmer, I already used a battery powered bikini trimmer and was eager to compare the two. It took me a little while to figure out how to hold the trimmer and angle it right. I felt like the trimmer could be a little better but it works. Also, the first time I turned on the trimmer I was disappointed to see that you had to hold the button down in order to make it work but on my second use, I pressed the button once and it stayed on. This is a minor problem but I definitely think this should be fixed because when I was holding the button down I would occasionally get hair caught when the trimmer would cut off suddenly. This was not a pleasant experience. But when I figured out how to get it to stay on properly, it worked perfectly. Overall, this is a great razor and a must-have for all those busy ladies out there!

It's like a one-stop shop for shaving, it's convenient to get it all done while in the shower at one time. The trimmer made it a lot easier to trim the &#34;forest&#34; so to speak, than using a regular razor. Even now, 18 hours later, I have no visible stubble, and my legs are still soft and smooth. I usually don't use a regular razor on my underarms because it can irritate and burn a little, but I didn't have that happen with this razor. Even my armpits still feel nice and smooth. I also used the razor on my bikini line in places that I prefer a closer shave. Usually this task is left to my Schick Intuition razor because I have never experience irritation, razor burn, or rash in this sensitive area using the Silk Effects razor. Again, I got an incredibly smooth shave and so far, I have not experienced any of the problems that I have had with other razors in that area. Now, there are some cons with this razor (hence the 4 star review and not 5 star). The handle is something to get used to on my legs because it is larger than my Quattro razor. I kept pushing the button for the trimmer and turning it on. I did not have a problem in the bikini area because the Silk Effects touts a larger handle. I do have to make sure I use care when shaving my legs, because I did cut the back of my ankle, and weirdly enough, the razor took a small piece of skin off of my shin. I had a small scab there, but it took more skin off than just the scab. The area is still a little tender, and I had to put a Band-Aid on it after I showered because it was bleeding. This won't deter me from using the razor though. It was user error on my part and not the fault of the razor itself.ad a small scab there, but it took more skin off than just the scab.   1075. I used to be a Venus razor girl all the way when I was in college because they were great for getting a close, smooth shave (and I got one free back in the day). Eventually I switched to using Schick brand because I had become disenchanted with the cost of refill cartridges. Since switching to Schick brand razors, I have felt that I was sacrificing somewhat in the quality of shave in order to save in overall cost.<br /> With the TrimStyle razor I actually double checked the brand name on it while I was in the shower because the feel in my hand was so similar to what I remember from using Venus brand razors. I was very happily surprised at the close, smooth finish to my legs after shaving and did not experience the need for multiple passes in order to get the job done. The razor is worth the price for the actual quality and precision of the main blade.<br /> As far as the trimmer head goes, I did not particularly expect to find much utility in this feature as it is not something I have tried before and it seemed a little bulky visually. I actually found the power button to be somewhat annoying because it only worked when you were holding the button down. It turned of as soon as you let go of it. I can only assume that this is meant to allow greater precision, but I felt that it was a little awkward. That said, the trimmer was actually surprisingly effective in trimming the areas that needed to go without endangering anything else. I had plenty of control and the process was pretty effortless. The blade guard allows for 3 different length settings depending on how it is adjusted or it can be removed for a closer trim. I was most impressed by the ability to shave over the top of my c-section scar without any tugging of the skin as this area continues to be very sensitive for me several years post surgery. I have not found any other products that even came close to trimming effectively over scar tissue without causing painful tugging or even cutting me in the process. This thing needs to be marketed to moms or anyone who has scarring eczema or other skin issues that cause regular razors not to work effectively for them.<br /> I am highly impressed with the overall quality of this product and feel that both the razor and the trimmer are excellent products when considered on individual merits. The fact that you can have both products in one device is an added and fantastic bonus! Well done Schick.<br /> I did receive a free sample of this product to test.he process.   1132. I already use Schick Hydro Silk razors, so when I received the Trim Style to try for free I was all for it. Here's the good, the good, and the not-so-bad.<br /><br />First of all, what is it? Well it is a lubricated five-blade razor with an attached trimmer that can be used either dry or wet. The trimmer has four settings from super close to a decent length.<br /><br />Now for the good. I really like the five-blade razor. You get a close shave without worrying about nicking yourself, and personally I liked the wide grip of the razor, which is wide for necessity's sake of the trimmer battery and motor. The battery, which came in the package, was easy to load, and the trimmer was easy to operate.<br /><br />As for the not-so-bad; I wasn't a huge fan of the moisturizing serum in the razor. It just comes in two strips flanking the blades, and while not bad, I didn't really find it made much of a difference. The bad part was it does bubble up after a period of time, and while I haven't found it to interfere with the shave, I could see how it could annoy some.<br /><br />Overall, it is a good razor. I'm not a huge &#34;trimmer,&#34; so I do not know if I could justify the cost, but if you are, then the Hydro Silk Trim Style could be the product for you.

The hanging hook (?) on the device gets in the way of your shaving, the design prevents the plain razor side from reaching tight spacing in &#34;lady land&#34; and the electric razor metal is sharp... sharp enough to cut me in several spots and make me bleed in a very sensitive area. Yes, the electric razor side comes with a shaving guide but I found this guide to be absolutely useless. Even at the shortest guide it barely removed any hair at all, nearly none. Also, I suggest you dont use this when your skin is at all moist. My skin was just normally moist, not from the shower or anything and I had problems. The electric side, with or without the the guide, sticks to moist skin and pulls at the skin. Sometimes so much so it was pulling the guide completely off the device. I gave this 2 stars because the plain razor side is REALLY sharp which is nice but the comfort gel strip gives off way too much slime or serum. I still had to switch back to my old razor to fully shave the area clean. Because of this and the scrapes from sharp electric razor side, I wont be reusing this product. Even though the plain razor side was nice, the bulky design isnt worth switching over from my old razor just to use the one side. Wait for the remodel if you plan to purchase this product and save yourself and your lady place from major irritation... or just by the razor in the refillable version.   1149. Thanks to BzzAgent, I recently tried out this product. The first time I used the Schick Hydro Silk® TrimStyle® razor, I went &#34;Wow!&#34;. It gives an amazingly close shave, which lasts for many days. The shape of the blade is nice, and the razor is flexible enough to go over the contours of the knees and elbows. Be extra careful the very first time you use it though - you may end up with nicks and cuts because the blades go over your skin very smoothly (which you may not be used to!). Once you get used to the motion of the blades, they are super easy to use!<br /><br />Also remember to use the razor directly on your skin after wetting the blades in water. There is also a water-activated gel within the razor, which means you do not need any extra product like moisturizing shave gel (which in turn saves you money, woohoo!). Initially, I felt like there was too much of the gel from the razor, which gave it a gooey appearance. But again, the next few times, the amount of gel was good enough.<br /><br />One really cool thing I noticed is that I did not get ANY bumps after I used this product, so that's definitely a HUGE plus!<br /><br />I'm not sure how long the blades last... so I shall update this when I have more info. All in all, it is the best product I have used so far over all these years (incl. disposable & reusable).

Honestly, I wasn't sure how to use it. There's not really clear instructions but I've seen my husband use one for his beard. It's a bit weird at first and doesn't get a ton of hair at once. I do like how there are different levels. You can take off the plastic part to get closer which I liked and actually used on the sensitive parts of my legs. Overall, I would probably buy another Schick Hydro Silk TrimStyle Razor when this one dies. I just love Schick razors, they are the best!
  1169. This razor the 2-in-1 trim style razor is a great concept but I think they need to work on improving the trimmer side! It doesn't get a close shave the regular razor side does a great job gives both a close and smooth shave everytime! Only thing is buying refills can be pricy..   1171. I was sent this razor by BzzAgent to review, which was really exciting! The downfall to the timing was that I was nine months pregnant upon receiving this razor and as anyone can guess, the huge belly kind of gets in the way of shaving legs, let alone &#34;trimming&#34; anything else up. However, I figured it would be as good a time as any to truly put this razor to the test since I would soon be silently judged by my OB and a small army of L&D nurses in regards to my ability to shave and keep everything smooth and tidy. I have to say, the razor itself is excellent. It's by far the longest lasting razor I've owned, as it cleans out really well so tiny hairs don't get gunked up and left behind. It also did a great job of not cutting up my legs like other razors have, especially considering that I was pretty much shaving blind and unable to see what I was doing for the most part. The razor cartridge also has some nice moisture to it, which I found eliminates the need for shaving cream as long as your legs aren't dry to begin with. I've also looked into the price of replacement cartridges and I totally think they're worth it for the quality you're getting. It's a similar shave to the schick intuition, but lasts through repeated uses, which makes it much more economical. The trimmer, however, I personally have found to be pointless. If your intentions are to simply trim up as in snip a little length off the lady bush but still leaving a good amount of hair, then it will probably be what you want. However, I prefer a closer shave and personally this did not cut it. I was hoping it would help to remove unwanted hair on the bikini line specifically as it suggests, but my hair is fine and thin, this trimmer thing didn't do anything to it. The razor, however, was perfect and didn't even cut me up despite the fact that I literally was trying to shave according to memory. And yes, the team of medical professionals attending my birth did compliment my excellent bush maintenance abilities (and my cute DIY pedicure, another true feat over nature). So while I've found the trimmer to be useless I'll say, I would absolutely recommend this razor because it's the best (and honestly safest) one I've ever used and I'll continue to buy cartridges to use it again myself!abilities (and my cute DIY pedicure, another true feat over nature). So while I've found the trimmer to be useless I'll say, I would absolutely recommend this razor because it's the best (and honestly safest) one I've ever used and I'll continue to buy cartridges to use it again myself!

  1179. If you're anything like me, your shower is cluttered with a few different razors and razor blades. While I have always been loyal to the Schick brand, I have never been loyal to one specific razor. I've spent the past 16 years that I've been shaving trying to find my favorite razor to use. Prior to receiving my complimentary TrimSyle courtesy of BzzAgent I was using the Schick Quattro For Women with the orange handle. While I love the four blades on the Quattro, I still felt like I was getting a rough shave after just a few uses. I am happy to say, however, that my search for my favorite razor is over.<br /><br />The first thing I noticed about the Schick Hydro SIlk TrimStyle when I took it out of the package was the wide handle that it has. Prior to using the TrimStyle I assumed that I wouldn't like the wide handle because my other razor was much skinnier. Boy was I wrong! I absolutely love the wide handle of the TrimStyle! It fits perfectly in my hand and even offers more control than my Schick Quattro.<br /><br />I have extremely dry skin so the fact that the TrimStyle is a hydrating razor is a huge draw to me. There are many times when I am in a hurry and don't have time to lather my legs with shaving cream. This razor works great with just soap. I love the feeling that the hydrating serum gives my legs. I normally knick myself every time I break out a fresh razor blade. That didn't happen with the TrimStyle! The hydrating serum also helps the razor navigate around tricky areas like the back and front of my knee caps. My legs feel so smooth and moisturized when I step out of the shower. The fact that the TrimStyle boasts a five blade razor blade is also a noteworthy attribute since my prior razor was a four blade. Who knew how much of a difference one blade can make!<br /><br />There have been many times when I have been stuck using my boyfriends trimmer for my lady parts. Those times are now over. I love the fact that I now have my razor and trimmer all in one place! I can shave my legs, then flip the razor over and trim up other parts. The trimmer also comes with an adjustable comb that has four different settings. I have only used one of the settings so far, but I am sure that over time, I will use the other settings.I have used the trimmer both in and out of the shower and it truly is a waterproof product. I have had no issues with it in the shower. It currently hangs in my shower and gets wet on a daily basis.<br /><br />I have only found one real potential issue with this razor. There have been times that I have been shaving my legs and I accidentally hit the button for the trimmer. This could totally be just me and the way I hold the razor. This would in no way deter me from buying this razor.<br /><br />This razor comes packaged with a fresh battery and the great part is that when you need a new one it take a AAA. No special batteries or a trip to a special store needed!<br /><br />I now use the TrimStyle on a daily basis and I would highly recommend it to anyone curious about using it!place! I can shave my legs, then flip the razor over and trim up other parts. The trimmer also comes with an adjustable comb that has four different settings. I have only used one of the settings so far, but I am sure that over time, I will use the other settings.I have used the trimmer both in and out of the shower and it truly is a waterproof product. I have had no issues with it in the shower. It currently hangs in my shower and gets wet on a daily basis.<br /><br />I have only found one real potential issue with this razor. There have been times that I have been shaving my legs and I accidentally hit the button for the trimmer. This could totally be just me and the way I hold the razor. This would in no way deter me from buying this razor.<br /><br />This razor comes packaged with a fresh battery and the great part is that when you need a new one it take a AAA. No special batteries or a trip to a special store needed!<br /><br />I now use the TrimStyle on a daily basis and I would highly recommend it to anyone curious about using it!

  1193. I like the trimmer part of this just fine. So when you try to shave, the lumps from the lubricant don't move (they've dried) and leave strips on my legs untouched by the razor. Plus the lubricant is kinda slimy gross goop when it does work. I end up scrubbing it off after (trying) to shave. I've even tried to scrape off the hardened lubricant to no avail. As you can see in the photo I've attached, the lubricant sticks out and blocks the blades. Scraping off the hardened goop is difficult to impossible.<br />The trimmer end is perfect. Why didn't I have one of these things before? Don't change a thing on the trimmer end.<br />Just ditch the goop.

It comes with the plastic attachment so you can choose your length, similar to what barbers use. I personally take it off for a close shave. I've been had any problems using. I use to get ingrown hairs all the time when I would just use a razor down there. But ever since switching to the trimmer I never get any ingrown hairs.
